name: Hilton Singer Island Oceanfront/Palm Beaches

reviews.text: This is the second year in a row I have stayed at the Hilton Singer Island. It has been remodeled since last year and it was much needed. The proximity to the beach, the fantastic pool, the ease of access to restaurants, groceries, carry-outs, and the friendly staff, are all reasons to consider this location. If you do plan to travel off the property, it is imperative that you rent a car.
reviews.title: All Around Winner

likes.disliked: — No free access to the internet in the business center

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The fact that you can walk out of the back doors of the hotel and be on the beach in about 20 seconds, is something you cannot find in many places. Speaking of the beach, I did feel the chair/umbrella, "cabana" rental fees were on the high side, and no consideration was given to discounting the rental fees for pre-payment, my length of stay/using chair and umbrella each day, etc...The seven days rental was just a few dollars less than my round trip airfare to Ft. Lauderdale. (I understand this equipment rental is a third party and not run by the hotel)
reviews.title: Leaves a lot to be desired at this Hilton

reviews.text: There is no question I would return to this property for a great beach destination, with plenty of conveniences and ammenities.
reviews.title: Great Location and excellent staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff, for the most part, was wonderful, especially David, one of the front desk staff. The hotel is located on the beach and the beach is just lovely and kept very clean. We were a little shocked, though, to find that there was a $30.00 per day fee for a double chair with cover for the beach. The beaches are public, so the hotels have no control over this. Now, we could have driven to Target and purchased 2 beach chairs for our stay, but, the "cabana" chairs were really very comfy and convenient.
reviews.title: Solid Three Star

likes.disliked: — Hall carpeting needed cleaning due to the traffic.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel rooms, though very nice, really left a lot to be desired. One room we stayed in we experienced a Niagra Falls type rainstorm from our ceiling. It's a very tired hotel and not any big deal. We would not stay here again.
reviews.title: Served it's Purpose
pleasant stay near the ocean
reviews.text: We stayed at this property for 4 nights. It was a pleasant hotel with a standard resort environment. Our room had an oceanview with sliding doors for access to the outside. The room itself was comfortable and clean. The pool area was rather plain but the pool was large and neatly kept. It had a nice dining area located outside which included a bar and entertainment. We enjoyed the breakfast buffet which featured an omelet stand, fresh fruit and waffles. The hotel people were very friendly and worked at making our stay pleasant and hassle free. We saw many families enjoying themselves at the pool and beachside.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would recommend this hotel for a family get away or relaxing weekend.
reviews.title: Great Hotel on the Beach

reviews.text: We liked this hotel and it's location on the beach. We ate lunch at the restaurant and had a good reasonable lunch with great service. We didn't use the pool but it looked very nice. The room was clean and we had a great view of the ocean. The hotel is a little out of the way and nothing is within walking distance but there are restaurants 10 minutes away by car. A nice place to stay for a good price.
reviews.title: Hilton Singer Island-OK

likes.disliked: — Everyday issues that were not taken care of

reviews.text: Hilton Singer Island is OK. The beach was great, hotel was priced right. Staff was curteous. Locations was terrific. However, we were there for 4 days and experienced nagging problems each day. The room was suffucient, and the outside of the hotel was run down. The childrens pool was too cold to enjoy, and the main pool was great.
reviews.title: Good hotel right on the beach!

likes.liked: — It is right on the beach.
likes.disliked: — No free walkup with internet service... they charge $$$ for minutes on internet. GET REAL!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Book this hotel if you plan on being at the beach a lot or if you want to be close to good shopping and dining.
reviews.title: Loved it, great place for the money.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We really loved this hotel. We stayed here for one night just because we were in town for a DMB concert. We got to the hotel early, but the friendly, nice front desk clerk was able to get us into a room (some places make you wait until check-in time without even checking to see if a room is available). We got a gorgeous full ocean view room without asking for one (and it looks like almost all the rooms have a partial ocean view). The room was really spacious and clean, there was a mini-bar AND a maintenance engineer brought us a refrigerator without us asking for one without ten minutes of our arrival.
reviews.title: Loved it

likes.liked: — On the beach; room was spacious and clean; everyone was so friendly; great bar

reviews.text: The hotel had an ice cream social in the afternoon where they gave away ice cream and then later before dinner, the hotel gave away champagne.
reviews.title: Great Tiki Bar!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The beach is right out the back door and there is also a huge pool and a great restaurant and tiki bar overlooking the ocean.
reviews.title: Good value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Everyone was so friendly at this hotel and I've never seen a hotel give away free ice cream or free champagne. It's true that there's not that much to do in this immediate neighborhood, but if you've got a car, you can go to Palm Beach or West Palm Beach. I think this is probably one of my favorite hotels; next time I would go back for a longer stay and just chill and relax at the pool, at the beach, and at the bar. This is the kind of hotel I would go back to year after year.
reviews.title: Such a nice getaway!!!

reviews.text: My boyfriend and I stayed for one night as part of a business trip. We had a nice room with a great view of the pristine beach. The staff was very helpful and accommodating, best part of the stay was hanging out at Coconuts, the outdoor tiki bar! Super-nice bartender who made me of the best Bloody Marys I've ever had.
reviews.title: Great experience

reviews.text: Our family of five stayed at the Hilton the week prior to Easter, and it had a nice family atmosphere, which we appreciated. Our first two nights were spent in a lower-floor room on the north side of the building. This room was small, had a small fridge, and a view of the reception hall roof, which had nothing to recommend itself. Because this portion of our stay was booked with Honor Points, we couldn't really do much about the room placement. However, we requested to be moved to a higher floor toward the beach side of the building for the remainder of our stay, and not only was this room larger, but the fridge was twice the size and the view was very pretty. I would recommend a room toward the beach on a higher floor to avoid a magnificent view of the tar roof and too much pool noise if you are on the south side of the building.
reviews.title: Nice pool--you will need a rental car

likes.liked: — Beach access, family atmosphere, access to outdoor activities
likes.disliked: — Room was pretty standard for the price, beach area not as big as other parts of Florida

reviews.text: The pool was one of the few "large" pools I've seen at a hotel--long enough to swim laps if you are a swimmer. Our boys loved it! It also had a small fitness center, and there was a good running trail right across from the hotel. This was not a good running beach, as it pitched pretty heavily toward the water, so the trail was handy.
reviews.title: Oh...the sounds of jackhammering!

reviews.text: You will also want a rental car, as there is nothing within walking distance except the hotel restaurant, which was actually pretty good. If you are looking for good places to take the family, try the Key Lime House on the channel in Lantana. Our waiter was outstanding, and he brought out extra cornbread at the end of our meal so our sons could feed the catfish off the pier. We also tried Saitos, a Japanese hibatchi restaurant in City Place, and Stone Rock Pizza on Clematis Street; both were fun and had outdoor seating if desired.
reviews.title: Room Cost and Beyond

reviews.text: For activities, Lion Country Safari Zoo was worth a visit to feed the giraffes, and we also went to a go kart/batting cage/rock climbing place in Boynton Beach whose name I can't think of offhand. The state park just north of the hotel was lovely, and our kids liked exploring the dunes and looking for shells.
reviews.title: What a dump

likes.liked: — We didn't like anything about the accommodation.
likes.disliked: — Too many things to list - see review.

reviews.text: Expect to pay for anything extra--that goes for the hotel and the area in general. Lots of valet parking, even at more casual restaurants. That's Palm Beach. The hotel was clean, comfortable, and adequate. Not a "resort", but definitely good for a family and the service was attentive.
reviews.title: Bad Experience

aka: Hilton Singer Island Oceanfront Hotel Singer Island
description: In town for the Orange Bowl 2014? Stay at the Hilton Singer Island Oceanfront Palm Beaches hotel and enjoy private beach access and stunning views of the Atlantic Ocean. Conveniently located between Central Florida and Miami, this Singer Island Hotel offers onsite restaurants, pool, kids program, event space and close to shopping, recreational activities and more.
